citation.article-title: Wohlfahrtiimonas chitiniclastica gen. nov., sp. nov., a new gammaproteobacterium isolated from Wohlfahrtia magnifica (Diptera: Sarcophagidae).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Wohlfahrtiimonas chitiniclastica sp. nov.

Wohlfahrtiimonas chitiniclastica (chi.ti.ni.clas′ti.ca. N.L. neut. n. chitinum, chitin; Gr. adj. klastos, broken in pieces; N.L. adj. clasticus, breaking; N.L. fem. adj. chitiniclastica, chitin-cleaving).
Cells are straight, short rods (1.5–2.0×0.5–1 μm), non-motile, occurring singly at all ages.
On King B agar medium colonies are non-pigmented, small, convex, entire, smooth and glistening.
Optimum growth occurs between pH 5.0 and 10.5, temperature optimum is at 28–37 °C.
Negative in Voges–Proskauer, aesculin, urease, indole, caseinase, gelatinase, amylase and H2S production tests, as well as for Tween 80 utilization.

Based on Biolog test results, both strains were positive for oxidation of glycogen, Tween 80, d-fructose, d-mannose, d-psicose, mono-methylsuccinate, acetic acid, formic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, propionic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, succinamic acid, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-alanyl-glycine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, l-threonine, glycerol, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid and dl-lactic acid, but negative for α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, adonitol, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, cellobiose, i-erythritol, l-fucose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, α-d-glucose, m-inositol, α-d-lactose, lactulose, maltose, d-mannitol, β-methyl-d-glucoside, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, xylitol, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, d-glucuronic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, sebacic acid, glucuronamide, alaninamide, glycyl-l-aspartic acid, glycyl-l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, hydroxy-l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, dl-carnitine, urocanic acid, inosine, uridine, thymidine, phenylethylamine, putrescine, 2-aminoethanol, dl-α-glycerol phosphate, glucose 1-phosphate, glucose 6-phosphate, malonic acid, α-ketovaleric acid and itaconic acid.
A varied reaction between the strains was observed for Tween 40, melibiose, methylpyruvate, l-leucine, l-proline, d-serine, l-serine, γ-aminobutyric acid and 2,3-butanediol.
The type strain, isolated from 3rd stage larvae of Wohlfahrtia magnifica (Diptera: Sarcophagidae), is S5T (=DSM 18708T=CCM 7401T).
